io.druid.indexing.common.task

Interface Task

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFixedIntervalTask, AbstractTask, AppendTask, ArchiveTask, DeleteTask, HadoopIndexTask, IndexTask, KillTask, MergeTask, MergeTaskBase, MoveTask, NoopTask, RealtimeIndexTask, RestoreTask, VersionConverterTask, VersionConverterTask.SubTask

    public interface Task
    Represents a task that can run on a worker. The general contracts surrounding Tasks are:
    • Tasks must operate on a single datasource.
    • Tasks should be immutable, since the task ID is used as a proxy for the task in many locations.
    • Task IDs must be unique. This can be done by naming them using UUIDs or the current timestamp.
    • Tasks are each part of a "task group", which is a set of tasks that can share interval locks. These are useful for producing sharded segments.
    • Tasks do not need to explicitly release locks; they are released upon task completion. Tasks may choose to release locks early if they desire.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getClasspathPrefix()
      Returns an extra classpath that should be prepended to the default classpath when running this task.

      Returns the datasource this task operates on.

      Returns group ID of this task.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        Returns ID of this task. Must be unique across all tasks ever created.
        Returns:
        task ID

      • getGroupId

        String getGroupId()
        Returns group ID of this task. Tasks with the same group ID can share locks. If tasks do not need to share locks, a common convention is to set group ID equal to task ID.
        Returns:
        task group ID

      • getTaskResource

        TaskResource getTaskResource()
        Returns a TaskResource for this task. Task resources define specific worker requirements a task may require.
        Returns:
        TaskResource for this task

      • getType

        String getType()
        Returns a descriptive label for this task type. Used for metrics emission and logging.
        Returns:
        task type label

      • getNodeType

        String getNodeType()
        Get the nodeType for if/when this task publishes on zookeeper.
        Returns:
        the nodeType to use when publishing the server to zookeeper. null if the task doesn't expect to publish to zookeeper.

      • getDataSource

        String getDataSource()
        Returns the datasource this task operates on. Each task can operate on only one datasource.

      • getQueryRunner

        <T> QueryRunner<T> getQueryRunner(Query<T> query)
        Returns query runners for this task. If this task is not meant to answer queries over its datasource, this method should return null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - query result type
        Returns:
        query runners for this task

      • getClasspathPrefix

        String getClasspathPrefix()
        Returns an extra classpath that should be prepended to the default classpath when running this task. If no extra classpath should be prepended, this should return null or the empty string.

      • isReady

        boolean isReady(TaskActionClient taskActionClient)
                throws Exception
        Execute preflight actions for a task. This can be used to acquire locks, check preconditions, and so on. The actions must be idempotent, since this method may be executed multiple times. This typically runs on the coordinator. If this method throws an exception, the task should be considered a failure. This method must be idempotent, as it may be run multiple times per task.
        Parameters:
        taskActionClient - action client for this task (not the full toolbox)
        Returns:
        true if ready, false if not ready yet
        Throws:
        Exception - if the task should be considered a failure

      • run

        TaskStatus run(TaskToolbox toolbox)
               throws Exception
        Execute a task. This typically runs on a worker as determined by a TaskRunner, and will be run while holding a lock on our dataSource and implicit lock interval (if any). If this method throws an exception, the task should be considered a failure.
        Parameters:
        toolbox - Toolbox for this task
        Returns:
        Some kind of finished status (isRunnable must be false).
        Throws:
        Exception - if this task failed
